text: you
hello and welcome to part two of cupcake
addiction's roast turkey feast tutorial
where I'll be showing you how to make
the second part of our roast turkey
feast which is our mashed potato and
gravy cupcake and our cherry pie cupcake
in part one we showed you how to make
the roast turkey cupcake and also the
carrots and peas on a plate cupcake so
check that one out if you want to get
the whole feast together tools and
equipment that I will be using today
I've got a rolling pin I've got two
butter knives I've got one sharp knife
I've got two cupcakes ready to ice a
little bit of cornflour just in a shaker
you can also use icing sugar I'm just
going to use that to prepare the surface
to roll out some caramel I've also got
two squares of caramel fudge I've got a
little bit about perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting and a little bit of
our chocolate ganache recipes and

channel if you'd like to know how to
make both or either I've got two circle
cookie cutters the larger one is a three
and a quarter inch or eight centimeter
and then the other one that I've chosen
is just about two sizes down from that
so it doesn't have to be an exact
measure just something that's a little
bit wider than the outside edge of your
cupcake put a little bit of melted dark
chocolate and I've got some mini M&Ms
and I've just picked up all the red ones
because I've decided on cherry pie today
we're going to start off with this
delicious potato and gravy cupcake it's
the easiest of the two so we'll get it
out of the way for this one we're just
going to take a couple of blobs of that
perfectly pipeable buttercream frosting
in white and just blot them on top now
you just want to work that back and
forward with the knife and careful not
to get it too far over the sides you
want to try and keep it as neat as
possible
add a little bit more if you think you
like more potato now I just smooth it
out I suppose push it out to the edges
and then flatten down the top a little
bit make sure you've got a relatively
flat top because you don't want all of
that gravy just to go like spilling off
the edges of it
so I'm just going to flatten out the top
I'm going to smooth off the edge a
little bit but you don't want it to be
too perfect because this is supposed to
be a bit of a mound of potato so after I
smooth off the edge I'm just going to
run my knife back and forward until I'm
happy that I've got something that looks
like a plate full of mashed potato all
right so I'm happy that looks like it's
a little bit of a mashed potato if you
do get any around the edges just use
your finger just to wipe up the edges
there just to clean it up
and for the gravy it's going to be as
simple as pouring a little bit of this
dark chocolate onto the top of the
cupcake now I like to pour it into the
middle and then I'm just going to give
it a shake and let it fall wherever it
wants to fall just like gravy would a
bit of a tap and see it start to inch
its way down the edges pull over the top
slide down the sides a bit so there you
have a delicious potato and gravy
cupcake now let's move on to our cherry
pie I decided for a chocolate ganache
frosting with the cherry pie I just went
with a chocolate ganache because I know
that it's going to take me a little bit
of time to lay out all those mini M&Ms
and I wanted to make sure I didn't get
something that was going to dry out the
buttercream tends to crust quite quickly
and it makes it hard for those M&Ms to
stick to it so I'm just going to make a
bit of a smooth dome of chocolate
ganache on this second cupcake I also
like the look of the dark peeking
through them between the M&Ms rather
than the stark white the dark seems to
blend in a little bit better so just it
doesn't have to be perfect a bit of a
dome there now I'm going to take a
little bit of that caramel fudge now
this is really soft caramel fudge so
it's not your caramel I suppose your

a need in between my hands just to

easy to knead if you're using a natural

until it's soft enough for you to work
in this way get a pop down a little bit
of
at cornflour this is just to prepare the

alright now I'm going to take the larger

a second
and then I'm going to just lift it up

shut it up with a bit of a ring now with
that ring it's just going to form

pull it around and it's really just
edging that cupcake giving the rest of

should have something that looks like
this a little bit messy at the moment
but we'll get there now this is probably
the most time-consuming part of this

like to start around the outside edges
and I'm just going to apply those M&Ms
around in circles until I hit the middle
and that's the last of them so now you
should have something that looks like
this now we're going to take the rest of

on the table
nice little wipe around in that corn
flour and we're going to roll out

that are going to go across the top and
these are what really make this pie I'm
not worried about the edges of the
strip's I don't mind if they're quite

going to cut across and make ten nice

going to start in the middle of my pie
and I'm just going to lay them across
I'm starting at the middle because I
want to make sure that I use my longest
ones where they're needed so I think I
used nine on this one here I'm just
laying that across the top
I'm just letting it sit on top of those
M&Ms for now
push it down a little bit if you like
the stick of the caramel will help to
stick it to the M&Ms turn it around
start in the middle once again with your
longest piece and work your way to those
outer edges
all right so once you've reached this
stage just give everything a little bit
of a push down starts to resemble more
of a pie then it's time to get our edges
organized so any of these little
leftover bits that are around the edges
just tack them up so just use your
finger in your thumb just to tuck them
up and as you're doing that pinch out
from the cupcake just tucking and
pinching until you get a nice little
guess a little crusty edge there for
your pie crust so that is our cherry pie
cupcake combined with our lovely mashed
